intro: Galium brevifolium, commonly known as short-leaved bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically less than 2 inches in length. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems and leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance.
